titles.ar: باب أَنَّ الْأَئِمَّةَ تَدْخُلُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ بُيُوتَهُمْ وَ تَطَأُ بُسُطَهُمْ وَ تَأْتِيهِمْ بِالْأَخْبَارِ ( عليهم السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 97 – The Imams<sup>asws</sup> are such that the Angels come over to them and tread their furnishings and come to them<sup>asws</sup> with the news

titles.ar: باب أَنَّ الْأَئِمَّةَ تَدْخُلُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ بُيُوتَهُمْ وَ تَطَأُ بُسُطَهُمْ وَ تَأْتِيهِمْ بِالْأَخْبَارِ ( عليهم السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 97 – The Imams<sup>asws</sup> are such that the Angels come over to them and tread their furnishings and come to them<sup>asws</sup> with the news

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ مِسْمَعٍ كِرْدِينٍ الْبَصْرِيِّ قَالَ كُنْتُ لَا أَزِيدُ عَلَى أَكْلَةٍ بِاللَّيْلِ وَ النَّهَارِ فَرُبَّمَا اسْتَأْذَنْتُ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ أَجِدُ الْمَائِدَةَ قَدْ رُفِعَتْ لَعَلِّي لَا أَرَاهَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ فَإِذَا دَخَلْتُ دَعَا بِهَا فَأُصِيبَ مَعَهُ مِنَ الطَّعَامِ وَ لَا أَتَأَذَّى بِذَلِكَ وَ إِذَا عَقَّبْتُ بِالطَّعَامِ عِنْدَ غَيْرِهِ لَمْ أَقْدِرْ عَلَى أَنْ أَقِرَّ وَ لَمْ أَنَمْ مِنَ النَّفْخَةِ فَشَكَوْتُ ذَلِكَ إِلَيْهِ وَ أَخْبَرْتُهُ بِأَنِّي إِذَا أَكَلْتُ عِنْدَهُ لَمْ أَتَأَذَّ بِهِ فَقَالَ يَا أَبَا سَيَّارٍ إِنَّكَ تَأْكُلُ طَعَامَ قَوْمٍ صَالِحِينَ تُصَافِحُهُمُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ عَلَى فُرُشِهِمْ قَالَ قُلْتُ وَ يَظْهَرُونَ لَكُمْ قَالَ فَمَسَحَ يَدَهُ عَلَى بَعْضِ صِبْيَانِهِ فَقَالَ هُمْ أَلْطَفُ بِصِبْيَانِنَا مِنَّا بِهِمْ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Sinan, from Misma’a Kirdeyn Al Basry who said, 
‘I did not used to increase upon eating once by the night and the day. So, sometimes I would ask permission upon vising Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, and find that perhaps the meal would have been raised and I would not see it in front of him<sup>asws</sup>. So when I would enter, he<sup>asws</sup> would call for it, so I would attain with him<sup>asws</sup> from the food, and I would not be harmed by that (the food at all). However, whenever I ate the food with others (people), I was not able upon settling and could not sleep due to gasses (indigestion). 
So I complained of what to him<sup>asws</sup> and I informed him that whenever I ate with him<sup>asws</sup> I am not harmed by it. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘O Abu Sayyar! You are eating the food of the righteous people<sup>asws</sup>. Then Angels shake their hands upon their<sup>asws</sup> furnishings’. I said, ‘And they appear to you<sup>asws</sup> all (Imams<sup>asws</sup>)?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> wiped his<sup>asws</sup> hands upon one of his<sup>asws</sup> children and he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘They are kinder with our<sup>asws</sup> children than we<sup>asws</sup> are with them’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْقَاسِمِ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ أَبِي الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ يَا حُسَيْنُ وَ ضَرَبَ بِيَدِهِ إِلَى مَسَاوِرَ فِي الْبَيْتِ مَسَاوِرُ طَالَ مَا اتَّكَتْ عَلَيْهَا الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَ رُبَّمَا الْتَقَطْنَا مِنْ زَغَبِهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Muhammad Bin Al Qasim, from Al Husayn Bin Abu Al A’ala, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘O Husayn!’ and he<sup>asws</sup> struck his<sup>asws</sup> hand to a cushion in the house, (then said): ‘A cushion, the Angels having had leaned upon it for long and sometimes we<sup>asws</sup> tend to find their fluff (from their wings)’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدٌ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي مَالِكُ بْنُ عَطِيَّةَ الْأَحْمَسِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ الثُّمَالِيِّ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ ( عليه السلام ) فَاحْتُبِسْتُ فِي الدَّارِ سَاعَةً ثُمَّ دَخَلْتُ الْبَيْتَ وَ هُوَ يَلْتَقِطُ شَيْئاً وَ أَدْخَلَ يَدَهُ مِنْ وَرَاءِ السِّتْرِ فَنَاوَلَهُ مَنْ كَانَ فِي الْبَيْتِ فَقُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ هَذَا الَّذِي أَرَاكَ تَلْتَقِطُهُ أَيُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ هُوَ فَقَالَ فَضْلَةٌ مِنْ زَغَبِ الْمَلَائِكَةِ نَجْمَعُهُ إِذَا خَلَّوْنَا نَجْعَلُهُ سَيْحاً لِأَوْلَادِنَا فَقُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ وَ إِنَّهُمْ لَيَأْتُونَكُمْ فَقَالَ يَا أَبَا حَمْزَةَ إِنَّهُمْ لَيُزَاحِمُونَّا عَلَى تُكَأَتِنَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam who said, ‘Malik Bin Atiyya Al Ahmasy narrated to me, from Abu Hamza Al Sumaly who said, 
‘I went over to Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bn Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup>, and I was withheld in the room for a while. Then I entered the room and he<sup>asws</sup> was picking up something and he<sup>asws</sup> inserted his<sup>asws</sup> hand from behind the curtain, and the one who was in the room took it’. So I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! This which I saw you<sup>asws</sup> pick up, which things was it?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Remnant from the fluff of the Angels. We<sup>asws</sup> gather it when they are around us<sup>asws</sup> to make it to amuse our<sup>asws</sup> children’. So I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! And they (Angels) tend to come to you<sup>asws</sup>?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘O Abu Hamza! They tend to crowd upon our<sup>asws</sup> cushions’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدٌ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَسْلَمَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ مَا مِنْ مَلَكٍ يُهْبِطُهُ اللَّهُ فِي أَمْرٍ مَا يُهْبِطُهُ إِلَّا بَدَأَ بِالْإِمَامِ فَعَرَضَ ذَلِكَ عَلَيْهِ وَ إِنَّ مُخْتَلَفَ الْمَلَائِكَةِ مِنْ عِنْدِ اللَّهِ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى إِلَى صَاحِبِ هَذَا الْأَمْرِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Al Hassan, from Muhammad Bin Aslam, from Ali Bin Abu Hamza, 
from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I heard him<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘There is none from an Angel whom Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Causes to descend regarding a matter what he descends for, except that he begins with the Imam<sup>asws</sup>. So he displays that upon him<sup>asws</sup>, and the interchange of the Angels (their coming and going), is from the Presence of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Blessed and High, to the Master<sup>asws</sup> of this Command’.
